WorkItem.ClosedComment: Duplicate of 19571 which has been fixed
WorkItem.Description: Loading characters from Battle.Net with standard names is fine. However, one of my characters has a "ú" in it. Rawr attempts to load, but the imported data is blank and it tells says that the "ú" is now "%c3%b".
WorkItem.Summary: [LoadCharacter] Issues with special characters in names

Comments.Message: Can you please provide your character's name and server/region so that we can test this?
Túrin (ironically, the site wouldn't let me register with it either). Vek'nilash-EU.

I'm assuming this is the same problem as 
http://rawr.codeplex.com/workitem/19571
19571 Is about the display of the characters since they are being encoded. Turin I believe is stating that having the special character is preventing him from loading his character.

Unicode string "Túrin" converted to UTF-8 and converted to an URI would be "T%C3%BArin"

The problem seems related to 19571 at least, there's a mismatch in the encoding of usernames/servernames (unicode) into the URI needed for the armory.

Other way around, the URI's seems to be used as is without decoding and converting back to unicode.
